item.name: Government ethics and transparency, public corruption

summary.text:
Amends Rule XI (Procedures of Committees and Unfinished Business) of the Rules of the House of Representatives to require each Member, Delegate, or Resident Commissioner to: (1) receive annual ethics training offered by the House Committee on Standards of Official Conduct; and (2) certify to the committee by January 31 of each year that he or she attended such training in the last year.

Requires the training to be the same given to senior staff by the Committee.

bill.title: Amending the Rules of the House of Representatives to require that Members take the same annual ethics training as senior staff.

dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
